blurb:
Hello! My name is Andrea R. Molino, ScM ðŸ‘‹

I am an epidemiologist and PhD candidate at the University of Washington School of Public Health in beautiful Seattle. Through my 9+ years of experience, I have developed expertise in epidemiologic methods, study design, effective data visualization, and scientific and commentary writing.

My work has been multidisciplinary, leading to a deep appreciation of the multifaceted nature of public health challenges. My interests lie at the intersection of epidemiology and health services research, with my dissertation focusing on HPV self-sampling and understanding how we can make cancer screening more accessible for all.

Prior to my PhD, I was as a research coordinator for a number of organ transplantation clinical trials, and a staff epidemiologist for a large cohort study of children with chronic kidney disease.
